connector.description: Send and receive messages to/from an XMPP chat server.

camel.source.path.port.name: camel.source.path.port
camel.source.path.port.description: Port number for the chat server

camel.source.path.participant.name: camel.source.path.participant
camel.source.path.participant.description: JID (Jabber ID) of person to receive messages. room parameter has precedence over participant.

camel.source.endpoint.nickname.name: camel.source.endpoint.nickname
camel.source.endpoint.nickname.description: Use nickname when joining room. If room is specified and nickname is not, user will be used for the nickname.

camel.source.endpoint.pubsub.name: camel.source.endpoint.pubsub
camel.source.endpoint.pubsub.description: Accept pubsub packets on input, default is false

camel.source.endpoint.room.name: camel.source.endpoint.room
camel.source.endpoint.room.description: If this option is specified, the component will connect to MUC (Multi User Chat). Usually, the domain name for MUC is different from the login domain. For example, if you are supermanjabber.org and want to join the krypton room, then the room URL is kryptonconference.jabber.org. Note the conference part. It is not a requirement to provide the full room JID. If the room parameter does not contain the symbol, the domain part will be discovered and added by Camel

camel.source.endpoint.serviceName.name: camel.source.endpoint.serviceName
camel.source.endpoint.serviceName.description: The name of the service you are connecting to. For Google Talk, this would be gmail.com.

camel.source.endpoint.testConnectionOnSt.name: camel.source.endpoint.testConnectionOnStartup
camel.source.endpoint.testConnectionOnSt.description: Specifies whether to test the connection on startup. This is used to ensure that the XMPP client has a valid connection to the XMPP server when the route starts. Camel throws an exception on startup if a connection cannot be established. When this option is set to false, Camel will attempt to establish a lazy connection when needed by a producer, and will poll for a consumer connection until the connection is established. Default is true.

camel.source.endpoint.createAccount.name: camel.source.endpoint.createAccount
camel.source.endpoint.createAccount.description: If true, an attempt to create an account will be made. Default is false.

camel.source.endpoint.resource.name: camel.source.endpoint.resource
camel.source.endpoint.resource.description: XMPP resource. The default is Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.connectionPollDela.name: camel.source.endpoint.connectionPollDelay
camel.source.endpoint.connectionPollDela.description: The amount of time in seconds between polls (in seconds) to verify the health of the XMPP connection, or between attempts to establish an initial consumer connection. Camel will try to re-establish a connection if it has become inactive. Default is 10 seconds.

camel.source.endpoint.doc.name: camel.source.endpoint.doc
camel.source.endpoint.doc.description: Set a doc header on the IN message containing a Document form of the incoming packet; default is true if presence or pubsub are true, otherwise false

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.connectionConfig.name: camel.source.endpoint.connectionConfig
camel.source.endpoint.connectionConfig.description: To use an existing connection configuration. Currently org.jivesoftware.smack.tcp.XMPPTCPConnectionConfiguration is only supported (XMPP over TCP).

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.name: camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.source.endpoint.user.name: camel.source.endpoint.user
camel.source.endpoint.user.description: User name (without server name). If not specified, anonymous login will be attempted.

camel.component.xmpp.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.xmpp.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.xmpp.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.xmpp.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.xmpp.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.xmpp.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
